summary: The Navy relies on 11 aircraft carriers based in ports on the East and West Coasts and in Japan to support U.S. defense objectives. These nuclear-powered ships require complex maintenance that may not be available near their homeports. When a ship changes homeports, more than 5,000 people may have to move: 3,200 crew and their families. The Navy annually updates its plan for positioning its...
title: Aircraft Carriers: Homeport Changes Are Primarily Determined by Maintenance Requirements
